block.p: Dr. Deborah Karush, a daughter of Dr. Ruth K. Karush and Dr. Nathaniel P. Karush of New York, is to be married today to Dr. Mark Edward Erwin, the son of Barbara and Edward Erwin of Corsicana, Tex. Judge Eduardo Padro of the Criminal Court in the Bronx is to officiate at Bridgewaters in Manhattan.
The couple are law students at New York University. They met at Clemson University in 1997, where both were visiting assistant professors teaching modern American literature.

Dr. Deborah Karush, a daughter of Dr. Ruth K. Karush and Dr. Nathaniel P. Karush of New York, is to be married today to Dr. Mark Edward Erwin, the son of Barbara and Edward Erwin of Corsicana, Tex. Judge Eduardo Padro of the Criminal Court in the Bronx is to officiate at Bridgewaters in Manhattan.
The couple are law students at New York University. They met at Clemson University in 1997, where both were visiting assistant professors teaching modern American literature.

The bride 33, is a summer associate in the New York office of Dechert Price & Rhoads, a law firm. She graduated summa cum laude from Princeton University and received a Ph.D. in English from Yale University. Her father and mother are psychiatrists in New York. Both are training analysts at the New York Psychoanalytic Institute.

The bridegroom, 30, graduated magna cum laude from Trinity University in San Antonio and received a Ph.D. in English from Princeton. His mother retired as an art teacher at the Collins Elementary School in Corsicana, and his father is a real estate developer there.
